definition: to unify/unified
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to gather/to unite/to unify/whole
unification (of the nation)/large scale unification
Da Yuan Dayitongzhi, Yuan dynasty geographical encyclopedia, compiled 1285-1294 under Jamal al-Din 紮馬剌丁|扎马剌丁 and Yu Yinglong 虞應龍|虞应龙, 755 scrolls
Da Yuan Dayitongzhi, Yuan dynasty geographical encyclopedia, compiled 1285-1294 under Jamal al-Din 紮馬剌丁|扎马剌丁 and Yu Yinglong 虞應龍|虞应龙, 755 scrolls
pinyin: Da4 Yuan2 Da4 yi1 tong3 zhi4

sentences.english: The transgenic canola plants are not about to take over the world.
sentences.chinese: 转基因油菜作物不可能将一统天下。

sentences.english: It had been nineteen years since Yellow Emperor unified the country.
sentences.chinese: 黄帝一统天下已经十九年了。

sentences.english: Yet the process of telling a story doesn't have to be unidirectional.
sentences.chinese: 然而讲故事的程式并不需要大一统。

sentences.english: Before modern times the "Old-Learning" had an absolute predomination in the educational field.
sentences.chinese: 近代以前，中国社会以传统的“旧学”教育一统天下。

sentences.english: Marxist ideology dominating the world, academia, of course, exemplifies the exception.
sentences.chinese: 马克思主义思想一统天下，学术界当然是莫能例外。

sentences.english: In a globalized world, beauty standards tend to merge.
sentences.chinese: 在全球化的现在，美的标准趋向一统。

sentences.english: The weather gets cold in November, and nothing is better than staying at your familiar hotel, working hard.
sentences.chinese: 在这初冬寒风起的十一月，还是躲进小楼成一统。

sentences.english: The occurrence and the development of the social insurance broke the law of tot's monopolization situation.
sentences.chinese: 社会保险的产生和发展打破了侵权法一统天下的局面。

sentences.english: In the integrated world, "The Great Mystery" goes in an opposite direction.
sentences.chinese: 在这个一统的世界里，大阴走的是不同的方向。

sentences.english: The first legacy is the concept of “Great Unity” so entrenched in Chinese people’s minds.
sentences.chinese: 首先是深入人心的中华民族“大一统”观念。

sentences.english: Neither Apple nor Google has grabbed much, if anything, from that lot.
sentences.chinese: 无论是苹果还是谷歌，都没有足够的实力一统天下。
第一章涉及的是“大一统”问题。

sentences.english: Then crystal scraps of all these rising in the dazzling beams added to their sum.
sentences.chinese: 于是一切耀眼光中上升的破片都汇成一统。

sentences.english: If Shu rule all the land, chopping and not cut is right.
sentences.chinese: 若是蜀国一统天下了，斩与不斩就都是对的了。

definition: the task of establishing and maintaining hegemony
unification (of the nation)/large scale unification
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
to recover (territory or power)/the liberation of Taiwan from Japanese rule in 1945
Guangfu or Kuangfu township in Hualien County 花蓮縣|花莲县[Hua1 lian2 Xian4], east Taiwan
to annex
to swallow up/to annex/to merge
the whole country in rebellion
to go on or send a punitive expedition
Han Dynasty term for the Roman Empire 羅馬帝國|罗马帝国[Luo2 ma3 Di4 guo2]
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
Sino-Turkish
to realign one's allegiance (to another religion, ruler etc)/to submit
the imperial court/the government in imperial times
destruction
to found a country
territory
